Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils

Class Utils_Byte

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.Utils_Byte
  • public final class Utils_Byte
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for byte and bit twiddling.

      • reverseBytes

        public static void reverseBytes​(byte[] data)
        Reverses the byte array order. This is useful when dealing with bluetooth hardware that is in a different endianness than android.

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(byte[] bytes)
        Returns true if the given byte array is either null, or has a length of 0.

      • memcpy

        public static boolean memcpy​(byte[] dest,
                             byte[] source,
                             int size,
                             int destOffset,
                             int sourceOffset)
        Copy from one byte array to another, with the given size, and offsets. Returns false if the source, or destination arrays are null, size + destOffset is greater than the destination array length, or size + sourceOffset is greater than the source array length. Otherwise, true is returned. This would also mean nothing is done to either array.

      • memcpy

        public static boolean memcpy​(byte[] dest,
                             byte[] source,
                             int size)
        Overload of memcpy(byte[], byte[], int, int, int), using 0 for both offsets

      • memset

        public static boolean memset​(byte[] data,
                             byte value,
                             int size)
        Set a value to size indexes in the given byte array Returns false if the byte array is null, or the size is greater than the array's length. This means nothing will happen to the byte array given.

      • memset

        public static boolean memset​(byte[] data,
                             byte value,
                             int offset,
                             int size)
        Set a value to size indexes in the given byte array starting at the given offset. Returns false if the offset is less than 0, or the array is null, or the size + the offset are greater than the array's length. The byte array is left alone in this case.

      • memeq

        public static boolean memeq​(byte[] buffer1,
                            byte[] buffer2,
                            int size)
        Compare two byte arrays. Returns true if each value matches for the given size

      • memcmp

        public static int memcmp​(byte[] b1,
                         byte[] b2,
                         int size)
        Compare two byte arrays.
